document.masterDocTitle: Aquatic Coleoptera (Dryopidae, Dytiscidae, Elmidae, Gyrinidae, Haliplidae, Helophoridae, Hydrochidae, Hydrophilidae, Noteridae, Psephenidae) of Iowa: Distributional Records and Notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Aquatic Coleoptera (Dryopidae, Dytiscidae, Elmidae, Gyrinidae, Haliplidae, Helophoridae, Hydrochidae, Hydrophilidae, Noteridae, Psephenidae) of Iowa: Distributional Records and Notes

subSubSection.paragraph:
Dineutus discolor Aubé. Allamakee
:
Upper Iowa R., Dorchester, MWB, 10/6/05; Black Hawk: Wapsipinicon R., Dunkerton, CTH, 8/2/06; Buchanan: Wapsipinicon R., Independence, CTH,9/3/13; Johnson: ( Wickham 1911 ); Linn: Wapsipinicon R., Troy Mills, CTH, 9/24/03. Distribution: Eastern USA , extending west to Minnesota in the north, Iowa , and Texas in the south.

Dineutus hornii Roberts. Cherokee
:
Cherokee, FJM, 6/10/56. Distribution: Eastern USA , extending west to Minnesota in the north, Kansas and Arizona in the south
.

materialsCitation.collectorName: Irish Hollow Cr. & New Albin & Bremer & Quarter Section Run & Waverly

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Irish Hollow Cr. , New Albin , DPH, 8/22/05;
Bremer :
Quarter Section Run , Waverly , CTH , 8/9/04; Floyd: Cedar R ., Carrville, CTH , 9/4/13. Distribution : Eastern USA , extending west to North Dakota in the north, Iowa , and Louisiana in the south.
New state record

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gyrinus affinis Aubé. Cedar
:
( Wickham 1911 ); Johnson: ( Wickham 1911 ). Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA , with Iowa forming part of the southern border in the Midwest.

Gyrinus bifarius Fall. Allamakee
:
Irish Hollow Cr., New Albin, DPH, 8/22/05; Mahaska: Buck Cr., Barnes City, KLS, 9/18/07; Winnebago: Beaver Cr., Lake Mills, CTH, 7/22/03. Distribution: Widely distributed and transcontinental in the USA . Its habitat preference is lentic and lotic environments. New state record.

Gyrinus dichrous LeConte. Johnson
:
( Wickham 1911 ). Distribution: Northeastern USA , with Iowa forming the southwestern border.

Gyrinus gibber LeConte.
(Oygur and Wolfe 1991)
. Distribution: Eastern USA , extending west to the Midwest. Iowa forms part of the western border.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Little Paint Cr. , Harpers Ferry , CTH , 8/10/11. Distribution : Northeastern USA , extending west to North Dakota in the north. Iowa forms part of the southwestern border.
New state record

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gyrinus lecontei Fall. Allamakee
:
Unnamed trib. to Village Cr., Lansing, CTH, 8/26/10; Clayton: Bluebell Cr., Millville, CTH, 5/28/15; Fayette: Unnamed trib. to Volga Lake outlet, Fayette, CTH, 8/4/15; Hamilton: Boone R., Tunnel Mill access, TMM, 10/5/10; Mitchell: Poor Cr., St. Ansgar, CTH, 3/30/15; Winneshiek: Coldwater Cr., Bluffton, CTH, 9/22/04. Distribution: Northeastern USA with Iowa forming part of the southwestern border.

Gyrinus minutus (Fabricius)
. Black Hawk:
( Wickham 1911 ); Johnson: ( Wickham 1911 ); ( Ferkinhoff and Gundersen 1983). Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA , extending south to Illinois , Iowa , and Kansas in the Midwest.

Gyrinus parcus Say.
(Oygur and Wolfe 1991)
. Distribution: Eastern USA , extending west to the Great Plains.

Gyrinus pectoralis LeConte.
A
single specimen is on record at the Illinois Natural History Survey (INHS), but has no collection/location data associated with it, other than it was collected in Iowa (Ed DeWalt, INHS, personal communication). Distribution : Northern transcontinental in the USA , with Iowa forming part of the southern border in the Midwest .

Gyrinus sayi Aubé. Howard
:
( Wickham 1911 ). Distribution: Northern transcontinental in the USA , with Iowa forming the southern border in the Midwest.
